elements.title: Aulus Vibenna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Etruscan tradition Aulus Vibenna (depicted on fresco) helped Servius Tullius to oust the Roman king Lucius Tarquinius Priscus?

elements.title: Taiari / Chalky Inlet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than 100 traps were set to catch a single stoat on an otherwise predator-free island in Taiari / Chalky Inlet in 2022?

elements.title: Housatonic Railroad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Housatonic Railroad used to send 100,000 US quarts (95,000 litres) of milk to New York City per day?

elements.title: Godwin Obasi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Godwin Obasi has been described as "Africa's gift to the world of climate science"?

elements.title: an anime adaptation of the source material (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than a decade after Edgar Wright assembled the cast of Scott Pilgrim vs. the World, he helped to convince them all to reprise their roles in an anime adaptation of the source material?

elements.title: Bahrainization (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as part of Bahrainization, the Bahraini government prohibited foreigners from driving taxis?

elements.title: Garnett Wikoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that delivering newspapers was how Garnett Wikoff became an Olympic runner?

elements.title: Hot Gay Time Machine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hot Gay Time Machine had two life-sized cut-outs of Beyoncé?
